alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Renville; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 11:50AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Chippewa, Renville and Yellow Medicine Counties. .Recent warm temperatures have acted quickly to melt snowpack and increase river flows. Additional precipitation expected today through Monday will delay crests on area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 889.5 feet, Flood waters begin to top the controlling bank at Highway 212. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1115 AM CDT Sunday, the stage was 887.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1115 AM CDT Sunday was 887.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 889.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 885.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 888.9 feet on 07/02/2011. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
